meanings.definition: Having or showing tenacity and grim persistence.
meanings.sent1: The dogged detective refused to give up on the case.
meanings.sent2: Her dogged determination to finish the marathon paid off in the end.
meanings.sent3: The dogged squirrel kept trying to reach the bird feeder, no matter how many times it fell.
meanings.sent4: His dogged pursuit of the truth led him to uncover a shocking conspiracy.
meanings.sent5: The dogged student studied late into the night to ace the exam.

meanings.sent1: Despite facing many obstacles, the dogged athlete never gave up.
meanings.sent2: Her dogged refusal to compromise on her principles earned her respect.
meanings.sent3: The dogged toddler insisted on wearing mismatched socks every day.
meanings.sent4: The dogged journalist pursued the story until she uncovered the truth.
meanings.sent5: His dogged commitment to his goals inspired those around him.

meanings.sent1: The dogged gardener worked tirelessly to revive the dying plants.
meanings.sent2: Her dogged focus on her studies helped her achieve academic success.
meanings.sent3: The dogged mechanic refused to give up until the car was running smoothly again.
meanings.sent4: His dogged determination to learn a new language paid off during his travels.
meanings.sent5: The dogged explorer braved harsh conditions to reach the summit of the mountain.
